{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3135356,"name":"Jonathan L.","username":"Jonathan_L","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonathan_l/{size}/6473_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-28T13:17:53.502Z","cooked":"

I think I found some places in the SPARK MAX documentation that seem self contradictory. I’m wondering which parts are true but also hoping this will lead to improving the docs.

When I hover over the com.revrobotics.SparkMaxPIDController.setReference(double value, ControlType ctrl, int pidSlot, double arbFeedforward, ArbFFUnits arbFFUnits) method to see its documentation, I read the following.

  • arbFeedforward A value from which is represented in voltage applied to the motor after the result of the specified control mode. The units for the parameter is Volts. This value is set after the control mode, but before any current limits or ramp rates.

  1. The diagram from the SPARK MAX documentation shows the Arbitrary FeedForward voltage being applied after the limits.

  2. It says that the units is volts but the next parameter is defines units.

  3. When set to percentage units is it a +1 to -1 value or an actual +100% to -100% value?

I see a deprecated warning on this function and can’t figure out how to call the method it is referencing so maybe fixing that would help?

Thanks in advance.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2023-01-28T13:17:53.502Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":307,"reads":163,"readers_count":162,"score":1572.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":424915,"topic_slug":"some-contrary-spark-max-closed-loop-control-documentation","display_username":"Jonathan L.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.revrobotics.com/sparkmax/operating-modes/closed-loop-control","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Closed Loop Control - SPARK MAX","clicks":21}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19457,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/some-contrary-spark-max-closed-loop-control-documentation/424915/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3135518,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-28T20:16:08.895Z","cooked":"
Jonathan_L:

I see a deprecated warning on this function and can’t figure out how to call the method

If you go to the Java documentation, you’ll see that the versions that use com.revrobotics.ControlType are deprecated in favour of those that use com.revrobotics.CANSparkMax.ControlType. It’s just a rename, so to change to the non-deprecated version, you need to change from ControlType to CANSparkMax.ControlType. This should not be causing you any problem.

Jonathan_L:

The diagram from the SPARK MAX documentation shows the Arbitrary FeedForward voltage being applied after the limits.

I agree that the diagram and accompanying text indicate that the arbitrary feedforward voltage is applied “after all calculations are done” but the method documentation suggests otherwise. (The C++ method documentation is similar.)

Jonathan_L:

It says that the units is volts but the next parameter is defines units.

I also agree that the method documentation is misleading when it says that the units of the arbitrary feedforward is volts when there is a version of the method that accepts a units parameter. I take this to be referring to the default unit when no unit is specified, and it was incorrectly copied into the documentation of the method that permits a unit. (This is slightly clearer in C++, which has default parameter values.)

Jonathan_L:

When set to percentage units is it a +1 to -1 value or an actual +100% to -100% value?

Percent implies it should go to 100, but I strongly suspect it goes to 1. I have seen a lot of APIs that say “percent” but mean “fraction of one”, especially in America. I don’t know why this specific terminological sloppiness is so common. Maybe there isn’t a good name for the interval [-1,+1].

So far as I’m aware, Rev don’t publish their source code anywhere (like Github) where you could submit a change request. My suggestion would be to contact them directly. You might like to propose specific changes.

bovlb:

So far as I’m aware, Rev don’t publish their source code anywhere (like Github) where you could submit a change request. My suggestion would be to contact them directly. You might like to propose specific changes.

Contacting their support is a perfectly valid approach, but I’d like to add that they also have this Trello board for publicly tracking changes related to the SparkMax firmware and APIs.
